Akkasah: Photography Archive (NYU Abu Dhabi)
'Egypt and Sudan Post Card Album' compiled by Edith and William P. Lincoln - Hisham Khatib Collection
Khatib, Hisham, Mr.
Lincoln, Edith
Lincoln, William P.
Lehnert & Landrock
AD.MC.030_ref165 40
213 Photographic Prints
February 1929 Generally good, some brittle and warped. An album of postcards of Egypt, from a journey in February 1929, compiled by William P. Lincoln and Edith Lincoln. The album also includes around ten gelatin silver prints, some which feature the crew of the Nile cruise taken, and ephemera such as newspaper clippings, passes to antiquities sites and a bill from the Shepheard's Hotel. The album belongs to the Hisham Khatb Collection. Electronic Records AD_MC_030_ref165
Content Description
Digital surrogates of an album of postcards of Egypt, from a journey in February 1929, compiled by William P. Lincoln and Edith Lincoln. The album also includes around ten gelatin silver prints, some which feature the crew of the Nile cruise taken, and ephemera such as newspaper clippings, passes to antiquities sites and a bill from the Shepheard's Hotel.
This album is part of the Hisham Khatib Collection of igital surrogates of 2,930 photographs and postcards (both individual prints and contained within albums) focused on the Near East, including the Holy Land, Palestine, Jordan, Turkey, Syria and Egypt as well as a very small number from Europe.
Processing Information
This collection consists solely of digital scans, Akkasah does not hold physical copies of these images.
This album has been digitized and is undergoing processing, please contact us for further information
